body.name: Unicorn Playlist: Another Phoebe and Her Unicorn Adventure (Volume 14)
body.merchantInfo: Ships from and sold by ZBK Books.
editorialReviews: Editorial Reviews From School Library Journal Gr 3–7—In the 14th book in the series, Phoebe, a young brown-skinned girl, and her pal Marigold the unicorn continue to reflect on the world, each other, and human-unicorn differences. The comic strips here cover many topics, including dealing with bad news in the world, reconciling different tastes in music, meeting Marigold's nonbinary cousin (pronouns: neigh/neigh're), and getting along with Phoebe's popular frenemy Dakota. Marigold's subplots involve magical creatures and ancient standards, while Phoebe's often include trappings of modern culture like smartphones and video games. Phoebe's innate curiosity and affability make her a great audience proxy, while Marigold is alternately Phoebe's humorous and comforting foil. Whenever they chat, friendship blossoms and deepens. The majority of pages use 2x2 panel layouts, with occasional changes of pace such as a gallery of unicorn vistas or a dragon's comedy roast performance. A glossary provides phonetic spellings and definitions of some of the book's vocabulary. VERDICT The dry wit, observational humor, and wholesome friendship at the core of the series have not dimmed one bit. Highly recommended.—Thomas Maluck About the Author Dana Claire Simpson grew up in Gig Harbor, Washington, drawing the entire time. She eventually graduated from The Evergreen State College, despite having spent all her time drawing, and not always for credit.From 1998 to 2008, she drew the internet comic strip Ozy and Millie. After winning the Amazon-sponsored Comic Strip Superstar Contest in 2009, Andrews McMeel Syndication signed her to a development deal for Heavenly Nostrils, which was later renamed Phoebe and Her Unicorn.She currently lives in Santa Barbara, California, with her tech genius spouse and her fairly stupid cat.

body.description: From newspapers to Nickelodeon, Phoebe and Her Unicorn is the most stunning unicorn feature around! This latest collection of Phoebe comics will delight middle grade readers and unicorn lovers of all ages. Best friends Phoebe Howell and Marigold Heavenly Nostrils march to their own beat, but life isn’t all rainbows and unicorns. With so many problems in the world and drama at school, Phoebe wonders why unicorns aren’t in charge instead of humans. With Marigold, each day is full of magic, from introducing Phoebe to unicorn music to crashing a goblin popularity contest, and even tracking down long-lost family members like Infernus, the Unicorn of Death (who ends up being surprisingly adorable). In Unicorn Playlist, Phoebe and Marigold play all the hits.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Phoebe and Her Unicorn in Unicorn Theater Unicorn Bowling The Unicorn Whisperer Camping with Unicorns Virtual Unicorn Experience Unicorn Famous Complete your Phoebe and Her Unicorn Collection! Book 8 Book 9 Book 10 Book 11 Book 12 Book 13

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Reminiscent of Calvin and Hobbes
reviews.reviewText: We LOVE these books. The whole series is fantastic. My 9 year old has read and reread them all. My 13 year old son has even read them and laughs. They’re very well written and they are enjoyable to read along with her. They’re easy to read but the Vocab is advanced, as is the humor. I like that there’s a glossary at the back to help when she asks what words mean. Valuable reading skill - go search it up.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 27, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Review by 9 year old series fan
reviews.reviewText: Review written by 9 year old series fanI was super excited when this book arrived. My mom preorders them so I get them in release day. I love this series because it's so much fun. I love the creativity and that the words aren't too difficult to read but also aren't too easy. The pictures are done well and the story is always fun

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 12, 2022
reviews.reviewText: Granddaughter gives them two thumbs up. She reads them, so we get them for her.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 10, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars 8 years olds favorite!
reviews.reviewText: My kids absolutely love the Phoebe and Her Unicorn series they can’t put them down and read them over and over. I love that they use so many “big words” with a great glossary in the back (in most of them). Fun books!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars One of the best in series
reviews.reviewText: My 8 year old loves this series! This is one of our favorites. Great quirky humor.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 26, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good graphics novel
reviews.reviewText: Very good for comic book lovers who like fantasy books and was a very good book to read, very funny and humorous

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 28, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Joyful, warm and comforting
reviews.reviewText: This series is full of joy. On a gray, hard day, my preordered copy of this book arrived and I tossed aside everything to curl up with it and a cup of hot chocolate. It was SO the right decision! By the time I'd read the first 20 pages, I was feeling so much happier and better about everything, and the whole book was, as always, a delight. I loved every moment of it.
My 8 year old granddaughter loves these books.
